column6: PHASE 1: Baseline: 1,000 PKR, represents 100% purchasing power.
Currency value remain stable above 90%                                             Reasons: Reason: Low Global oil prices and CPEC investments keep inflation under 5%.
In 2016, monthly inflation fluctuates between -0.7% and 1.5% keeping the notes's strength nearly intact.
In 2017, annual inflation begins to appear(ranging from 2.9% to 5.3%),but the 900 PKR floor is never broken.
Phase 1 Exit: 1000 PKR retains 96% of its value. This marks the last month before the "Erosion Phase" begins.
PHASE 2: Moderate Erosion; the 900 PKR threshold is broken for the first time.

Purchasing power remains in the 800+ range ;moderate erosion                                                                                        Reason:Reason: Global oil price stability and initial IMF stabilization efforts kept the drop gradual.
value drops below 800 PKR for the first time
COVID-19 pandemic disruptions to local supply chains             Reason: Global Trade lovkdowns caused price instability in essential goods.
COVID-19 pandemic disruptions to local supply chains

COVID-19 pandemic disruptions to local supply chains
COVID-19 pandemic disruptions to local supply chains

COVID-19 pandemic disruptions to local supply chains
Phase 2 Exit: Final month before transition into High Inflation Crisis
The start of high -inflation era                                                           Reason: Caused bt political instability and global commodity price surges.
Shock Event: Massive 6.3% Monthly Spike                                   Reason: Removal of Petrolium Subsidies and a sharp spike in electricity tariffs.
Phase 3 Exit: 1,000 PKR now holds less than 40% of its 2016 value
PHASE 4: The Historic Peak and Recovery Attempt. Inflation hits its absolute maximum due to political instability and energy price shocks.
Sudden Fall: Purchasing Power continues sharp drop.
purchasing power rises due to-6.4% deflation
Phase 4 Exit : The year ends with zero monthly growth,signaling the end of the high-volatility 2023 period.

Phase 5: Transition to Stagnation. Purchasing Power starts to weaken.                                                                                                             Reason : A sudden 1.7% monthly jump cause a significant drop in value.
Sudden Rise : Value recovers due to -0.4% deflation.
purchasing power continues to rise due to -3.2% deflation.
Sudden Fall : Brief recovery ends; purchasing power starts to fall.
Sudden Rise : Purchasing power rises due to -0.5% deflation.
Sudden Rise : Purchasing power rises due to -0.8% deflation
Sudden Rise : Purchasing power rises due to -0.8% deflation
Purchasing power continues to rise due to -0.2% inflation.
Sudden Rise : Purchasing power rises due to -0.6% deflation
Phase 5 Exit : The year ends with deflationary correlation (-0.4%) driven by improved food supply . While Purchasing power sees a small sudden rise.
